III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The program where the office will be located is a large house that was built in the
1940’s. This house has a large living room with a fire place, a dining room on the
first floor along with a kitchen, a full bathroom, two rooms that will be converted into
offices and a pantry. The second floor has five bedrooms and a full bathroom. The
basement is finished with six rooms that will be offices for staff and storage space
for client’s records. The house has a large shaded front porch with trees in the front
of the house that keeps the porch cool in the hot summer months. The house was
observed to be clean and in good repair.
B. Program Description
2

Community Care Organization recognizes a need to provide services to youth 16
years and older in an independent living arrangement through host homes or
apartment setting. CCO states the following objectives:
• Recruit and support host homes that coach and mentor young adults.
• Offers 24 hour emergency contact.
• Group and individual counseling.
• Individualized lesson plans for high school completion, act sat prep, and
entrepreneurship training, college prep support.
• Substance abuse treatment.
• Phasing component to move youth towards less restrictive living environment
• Daniel Memorial computer generated individualized lesson plans to address
life skills
• Specialized Supervised Independent Living component
• Supportive Housing
• Job skills and soft skills training and support
• Job placement for youth and career counseling
• 8 hours of training for home provider candidates
• Outreach services
• Supportive Services to youth’s family
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There were no violations.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend the issuance of an Original Provisional License to Community Care
Organization.
